Dear Mr. Hannah:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 Be signed and dated.
A six-month provisional license is recommended. If you do not contest the issuance of a
provisional license, you must indicate so in writing; on the attached document. If you
contest the issuance of a provisional certificate of approval, you must notify this office in
writing and an administrative hearing will be scheduled. Even if you contest the issuance
of a provisional license, you must still submit an acceptable corrective action plan.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for
the continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff members are not attentive towards youth or providing
appropriate supervision. Youth was assaulted by other youth at
the facility, and it is unknown where staff were when this occurred.
Investigation A complaint was received on 3/3/23 stating staff at the facility
were not paying attention to Youth A and other children at the
facility. On the evening of 3/1/23 Youth A was jumped by an
unknown group of youth in one of the bathrooms. It was unknown
where the staff were at the time of the incident.
Interviews:
At the facility on 3/6/23 the Program Manager (PM) was met with
face to face. She reported Youth A antagonizes everyone. Youth
A has a safety plan that includes a one-on-one staff. They also try
to remove the group when he acts out.
3

Youth A/Complainant was interviewed face to face at the facility
on 3/21/23 and 4/25/23 along with the DHHS Worker. Youth A
reported he has a one-on-one staff because of his safety plan. He
reported it depends on the staff if they provide adequate
supervision or not. The staff supervise them, but they do not do
anything if something happens. On the night he was "jumped" he
was in Unit 4 playing video games. He said the incident occurred
around medication time which is around 6 to 7pm. He reported
Staff 7 was passing out medication. The youth started to run in
and out of the unit. Youth A said Staff 12 was in the back on her
phone. The youth started to throw wipes and diapers around the
unit. Youth A said that is when he was jumped. He found a
bathroom stall door leaning up against the wall in the bathroom,
so he initially used it as a shield. He said Youth C, Youth E, and
Youth G got a hold of him in the bathroom and began punching
and kicking him. Youth A reported he had bumps on his head
afterwards. He said Staff 8 was telling the youth to get out of the
bathroom. Youth A was unsure if staff went into the bathroom and
stopped the youth or if they just stopped on their own. Afterwards
Staff 2 took Youth A to the hospital. Youth A reported the incident
lasted about 3-5 minutes. He said no rules were being enforced
that night. Youth A said he would feel safer at the facility if he
knew staff would intervene if something were to happen.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/21/22. He
reported he is familiar with Youth A. Staff 1 said Youth A will often
instigate his peers by saying things he knows will upset them.
Staff 1 reported he usually works second shift. He did not work
when Youth A was jumped, nor did he work the day following. He
said he has not seen any youth assault Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/21/23. Staff
2 reported on the evening of 3/1/23 he was working on Unit 3.
Around 7pm or so he was trying to get the youth to complete their
details. He said the other staff working with him had gone on
break and Staff 9 was there in his place. Staff 9 was in the back of
the unit. Staff 2 said the youth were at the door so he told them to
get away from the door. The youth shoved Staff 2 out of the way
and ran out the door to the unit across the hall. Staff 2 said he was
directed by Staff 7 to get the youth out of the other unit so he
followed them. He said the youth ran to the bathroom and began
to fight. Staff 2 did not see the fight but heard it. He stated two
staff, whom he could not remember, were standing by the
bathroom watching the fight not intervening. He could not recall
who the staff were. He said there was a staff in the back room of
the unit as well, but he did not know who it was. He stated the
4

incident lasted about 10-20 minutes. He said Staff 7 was handing
out medication, so she was unable to intervene. Staff 9 only came
when Staff 7 called for him a couple of times. Staff 2 did not know
why Staff 9 did not come when all the youth left the unit. Staff 2
thought Staff 8 was trying to break up the fight. He did not recall
seeing Staff 12. Staff 2 said he did not know why the other staff
did not intervene. He stated the staff were not afraid of the youth
because they have broken up fights before.
Multiple attempts were made to contact Staff 2 for follow-up
questions. This consultant and the DHHS Worker left him several
voicemails and the DHHS Worker visited his home twice. Staff 2
was not present either time and never returned our phone calls.
Staff 2 no longer works for the facility.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/21/23. She
has worked with Youth A before. She said she was not working
the day Youth A was jumped. Youth A argues with his peers and
instigates them by saying things he knows will upset them. She
has not seen Youth A get into a fight with other youth.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/23/23. He
stated the day of the incident with Youth A he was in Unit 3 which
is across from the empty unit (Unit 4). He said Staff 2 and Staff 15
were working at the time. Staff 15 was in the back of the unit on
her phone. He said him and his peers ran over to Unit 4. He said
Staff 7 was passing medication at the time and was holding the
door to Unit 3 open in order to pass medications. Youth E said
Staff 2 stood in front of the door to Unit 3 trying to block the youth
from exiting. He said Staff 2 then called group attention so they
would circle up and address what was going on. Staff 2 did this to
get them calmed down. Youth E said when Staff 2 moved away
from the door for the group attention the youth ran out of Unit 3.
Staff 2 followed them out and into Unit 4 across the hall. While in
Unit 4 he said all the youth were messing around and running
around. Youth E said Youth A threw wipes at Staff 8. Youth A then
threw a bathroom stall door. Youth A went into the bathroom.
Youth E, Youth C, and Youth G went in and fought Youth A. Youth
E reported Youth A was standing when Youth G jumped over the
stall to get Youth A. Youth A then fell. Him, Youth C, and Youth G
began to punch Youth A. Youth E said he and his peers punched
Youth A for about 5-10 seconds. He said Youth B tried to go into
the bathroom to fight Youth A, but Staff 8 stopped him. Youth E
said he went back into the bathroom and hit Youth A again. Youth
E said none of the staff came into the bathroom because they
could not get in. He said Youth G stood in front of the door so staff
5

could not get though. Youth G hit Youth A 3 to 4 times. He
reported Staff 8 went into the bathroom after the fight to check on
Youth A. He said Staff 12 was at the back table and never came
to help. Staff 2 was by the doorway calling for help. He said Staff 7
continued to pass medication during the fight. Youth E said he
wanted to beat Youth A up because Youth A was throwing things.
He did not know if Youth A had any bruises. He said he hit Youth
A in the mouth but Youth C and Youth G hit Youth A everywhere.
Youth E reported some staff do not watch them good enough
because the staff will be on their phones. He reported Staff 15 is
one of the staff that is always on her phone rather than watching
them.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/23/23. He
reported the staff working the night of the incident with Youth A
were Staff 2 and Staff 15. He said Staff 7 was passing medication.
The youth were talking to Unit 4 through the door. He said Staff 7
was outside the door passing medications to the youth in Unit 4.
He said he, Youth E, and Youth G went past Staff 7 to get into
Unit 4. Youth C reported Staff 7 saw them go into Unit 4, but she
did not say anything. He also said Staff 2 followed the youth into
Unit 4. He said Staff 15 said she did not care what they did. Staff 8
and Staff 12 were in Unit 4. He said the youth in Unit 4 were
throwing diapers and wipes at Youth B. Youth B walked out of the
unit and Youth D followed him. Youth E said Youth A was playing
around doing kid stuff in the bathroom. Staff told him to leave the
bathroom. He said Youth A came out of the bathroom with a door.
He said Youth G ran into the bathroom and smacked Youth A
down. He, Youth G, and Youth E began to punch Youth A. He
could not recall if they kicked him. He said they were punching
Youth A for about 50 seconds and none of the staff were around.
Youth C said he and Youth G left the bathroom on their own. He
said Staff 8 walked into the bathroom and was talking to Youth A.
Youth C was telling Youth A to come out of the bathroom. When
Youth A came out, he was going to hit Youth A again, but Staff 8
stopped him. Youth C said the staff were busy trying to stop the
youth from throwing things at Youth B. He said Youth B also tried
to fight Youth A. He reported the staff usually break up fights that
occur between the youth but this night the staff did not know the
youth were in the bathroom fighting. The staff did not know this
because they were watching other youth. He said there was a lot
going on at the time.
Youth F was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/23/23. He
reported he was in Unit 4 the night of the incident with Youth A.
His entire unit (Unit 2) was in Unit 4 to play games. He said Staff 8
6

and Staff 12 were working at the time. Youth B then needed to get
his diaper checked. This made Youth B mad, so he left the unit.
Youth F reported Youth D was already off the unit so when Youth
B exited the unit, he began to chase Youth D around with a brown
spot on his arm. Youth F said the medication cart was in the
middle of the hall with Staff 7. Youth D was banging on Unit 4’s
door to be let in. Youth F said Staff 7 was laughing while Youth D
was being chased by Youth B. Youth B was let into Unit 4 and he
chased Youth A who went into the bathroom and threw wipes at
Youth B. He said Youth B again left the unit and Youth D came
back in. Youth F reported the youth from Unit 3 pushed past Staff
2 and ran into Unit 4. Staff 2 followed them in to get them to leave
Unit 4. Youth F said Youth B came back to the unit with a
bathroom door saying he was going to hit Youth A. Youth B
dropped the door as Youth C, Youth E, and Youth G ran into the
bathroom to go after Youth A. Youth F said he was not in the
bathroom, but he could hear the hits. Staff 8 went into the
bathroom after about 4-5 minutes. He said Staff 12 was dealing
with the other youth in Unit 4. Youth F said he did not know where
Staff 8 was prior to her entering the bathroom. He reported the 3
youth were able to beat Youth A up without staff intervening. He
said Staff 8 entered the bathroom because Youth A was
screaming. Youth F saw Youth A with a welt on his head when he
came out of the bathroom.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/23/23. He
stated he was in Unit 4 playing video games when a bunch of
youth ran into Unit 4 and started messing with him. He said Youth
A was in the bathroom disrespecting staff and he got punched by
some youth. Youth B did not specify what youth hit Youth A. Youth
B reported staff followed the youth when they ran into Unit 4.
Youth C and Youth E ran into the bathroom and punched Youth A
once. He said staff tried to prevent it by being in their way. When
staff moved out of the way Youth A got hit. Youth B said staff
moved because they did not want to get hit. Youth B did not
specify which staff tried to prevent the fight. The youth fought
Youth A because he was “talking crap”. Youth B said he was in
the bathroom at the time of the incident, and he saw Staff 8 in the
bathroom with them. He said staff always break up fights between
the youth. Youth B clarified that Youth A first went into the
bathroom then Staff 8 then the other youth.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/23/23. He
reported his unit, Unit 2, he was in Unit 4 at the time of the
incident, and everyone was chilling until some of the youth from
his unit started to be bad. He did not remember what staff was
7

working. He said the youth from his unit were playing games,
medications were being passed, then the youth started throwing
wipes. Youth D did not specify who was throwing the wipes. He
asked his staff if he could go back to Unit. He was allowed to go
back to Unit 2 with a staff. Youth D could not recall what staff took
him to Unit 2. Youth D said he came back to Unit 4. When he got
Youth A, Youth C, and Youth E were in the bathroom. He said the
staff were pulling Youth G off Youth A and he helped them. He did
not know what staff was there. He also did not see Youth A with
any injuries. He saw Youth A getting hit in the face but not hitting
back. He said he has not seen any other fights between youth at
the facility.
Staff 7 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/23/23. She
reported she is a supervisor on second shift. On the evening of
the incident with Youth A she was in between Unit 3 and Unit 4
passing medication. She was at Unit 3's door so the door was
open. She said Unit 4's door was opened and closed periodically
so she was not sure if it was open or closed at the time Youth C,
Youth E, and Youth G ran out. She stated Staff 2 opened the door
to Unit 3 for her. The medication cart was blocking the doorway
and Staff 2 was on the side of the cart. She said she gave Youth
H his medication and that is when Youth C, Youth E, and Youth G
ran out of Unit 3, past the medication cart, and into Unit 4. She
reported Unit 4 was loud at the time. Staff 2 followed Youth C,
Youth E, and Youth G to Unit 4. She went to pack up the
medication cart, but Youth H wanted a PRN medication. Staff 7
said she heard a loud ruckus on Unit 4. Youth F opened the door
to Unit 4 and she saw Staff 8 in the bathroom covering Youth A.
She said Staff 12 was holding the rest of Unit 2 back. Staff 7 said
she then went into Unit 4. Youth G was on Youth A and Staff 2
was pulling Youth G off Youth A. Staff 7 did not see Staff 9. Staff 7
said Staff 15 was on break. She reported the unit was noisy, but
they had been doing good. She reported Youth C, Youth E, and
Youth G intimidate both youth and staff.
Staff 9 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/23/23. He
reported he is a supervisor. At the time of the incident on 3/1/23
he was working on Unit 3 while Staff 15 was on break. Staff 9 said
he was sitting in the back of the unit when 2 kids from another
unit, Youth B and Youth F ran into Unit 3. They told Staff 9 they
were just playing. He went to Unit 3 door and saw most of the
youth from Unit 3 had left with Staff 2. He did not see them leave
Unit 3. He said there were 4 youth on Unit 3 at the time. Three of
the four youth had left the unit. When Staff 9 came out of Unit 3 he
saw Youth G walking with a door. He took the door away and took
8

it into the office. When he came back Youth B was upset, and
Staff 7 was passing medication. He went into Unit 4 and saw
Youth C and Youth E coming out of the bathroom after them Staff
8 and Youth A came out. He said Staff 12 was also on Unit 4.
Staff 9 removed everyone from Unit 4. Staff 9 then left shift shortly
after this. He stated he was supposed to leave at 7pm and it was
already past 7. Staff 9 said he did not see Staff 7 on Unit 4. No
one called for Staff 9 during the incident. Staff 9 reported that staff
do intervene in any fights between the youth. He is someone who
often intervenes.
Staff 8 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/23/23. She
stated she was working on Unit 2 the night of the incident. She
reported Unit 2 was playing games in the empty Unit 4. She stated
it was loud and there was a bunch of commotion. She saw Staff
12 move toward the commotion then saw Youth G on top of Youth
A in the bathroom. She went to them and covered Youth A with
her body. Staff 2 pulled Youth G away. Staff 7 came onto Unit 4
and told everyone to go back to their units. Staff 8 said she never
saw Youth C and Youth E in the bathroom. She stated when
everything started, she was in the back of the unit with some of
the youth. She could see the bathroom from the back of Unit 4
where she was sitting. She heard Staff 12 tell the youth to calm
down. Staff 2 was not in the bathroom when she first got to the
bathroom. Throughout Unit 2's time in Unit 4, Youth A was running
in and out of the unit. Staff 12 was in the middle of the unit.
Youth H was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/23/23. He
stated he was on Unit 3 the night of the incident with Youth A.
Staff 15 was sitting in the back of the unit on her phone. Staff 2
called a group meeting. He did not remember Staff 9 being on the
unit. He said medication was being passed. Staff 15 did not leave
the unit when Youth C, Youth E, and Youth G left but she stayed
on her phone. Staff 7 gave him his medication before Youth C,
Youth E, and Youth G ran out of the unit then she went after the
youth. Later Youth H saw Youth A with a lump on his head. Youth
H said the door to Unit 3 was left open because the unit was hot.
He said Youth C, Youth E, and Youth G did not push by him to get
out of Unit 3 so he was not at the door when they ran out.
Youth G was interviewed face to face at his current placement on
3/28/23. Youth G said he was familiar with Youth A because he
put his hands on Youth A. He said Youth A swung at Youth G, so
he hit him back. He did it because Youth A threw a stall door at
him. He said Youth A was also putting his hands on female staff.
Youth G said he was on Unit 3 and Youth A was on Unit 4 across
9

the hall. Staff 8 knocked on Unit 3's door and asked for staff. Six
youth from Unit 3 went over to Unit 4. Staff 7 was passing
medication and Staff 9 was on Unit 3. Staff 9 tried to grab Youth
G, but Youth G pushed Staff 9 out of his way. Staff 12 was on Unit
4 at the time and no other staff were present. Youth G said Youth
A hid in the bathroom, so Youth G ran in after him. He said Youth
A antagonizes him by saying stuff about his dead mother. Staff 8
tried to grab Youth G before he went after Youth A and while
Youth G was punching Youth A, but she is too small so she could
not stop him. Youth G said he stopped assaulting Youth A
because he knew he had gone too far by stomping on his head
and kicking his head. He said prior to exiting Unit 3 Youth G heard
a ruckus and banging coming from Unit 4. He is nosey and
wanted to see what was going on.
Staff 12 was interviewed face to face at her home on 4/3/23 by the
DHHS Worker 2. This consultant participated by phone. Staff 12
reported on 3/1/23 Staff 7 wanted Staff 12 to write an incident
report about what happened that night, but she refused because
Staff 8 saw more than she saw. Staff 12 believed this is why Staff
7 lied about Staff 12 allowing Youth D to use her phone. She said
she never let a youth use her phone and Youth D had a tablet he
was using. She reported Staff 7 met with Youth D and Youth F
later that night in her office. Staff 12 thought Staff 7 was coaching
Youth D and Youth F as it was late, and she met with them away
from the unit which is not typical. Staff 12 was terminated the next
day as Staff 7 had reported Youth D had Staff 12's phone in his
hand. Staff 12 was present for the incident with Youth A. She said
it was her and Staff 8 working that evening. They were working on
Unit 2 but Unit 2 was in Unit 4 playing games. During the evening
all the youth from all of the units were running on to other units
and into the halls and Staff 7 was allowing this. She said Staff 8
was in the front of Unit 4 by the front door and Staff 12 was at the
back. Staff 7 had the medication cart in the hallway between Unit
3 and Unit 4. Youth from Unit 1 and Unit 3 came to Unit 4 and
were picking on Youth B. She told them to all go back to their
units. She did not see Staff 9 and did not know Staff 9 was
working until later when someone mentioned him. Staff 12 said
Youth B wanted to fight Youth A. Youth A began to throw briefs
and wipes at Youth B. Youth A then went to hide in the bathroom.
She told Youth A to get out of the bathroom, but he would not
come out. Youth E said he would get Youth A out of the bathroom
then went in after him. Staff 8 then went in the bathroom. Staff 7
was still at the medication cart and Staff 2 stood by and watched.
Prior to the fight Staff 12 was trying to get Youth B calmed down
as he wanted to fight Youth A. She did see youth from Unit 1 and
10

Unit 3 enter the bathroom, but she could not recall what youth.
She said Staff 8 was in the front by the bathroom and Staff 12 was
behind Staff 8 so she could not see what was happening. When
they were trying to get the youth out of the bathroom Staff 2 was
standing in the middle of Unit 4. Staff 2 came into Unit 4 when the
youth were in the bathroom fighting. He was not in the unit the
entire time. He did not do or say anything to the youth. When
Youth A came out of the bathroom, he had a lump on his head,
and she thought he had a cut lip. Staff 12 could not remember
what youth were present. The youth left the bathroom when her
and Staff 8 told them to. She saw Youth E run out to the back door
and she followed him. Staff 12 clarified that Staff 7 got the
medication cart out while the youth were running from unit to unit.
Things were not stable enough to be passing medication at that
time. Staff 7 came into Unit 4 after the fight occurred.
Tour:
During a tour of Unit 4 on 3/23/23, the door to Unit 4 opens into a
dorm style room with beds and two TV's. The bathroom is straight
ahead and to the right of the door. The bathroom does not have a
door leading to it.
Staff 8 was asked to point out where she was and she pointed to
the back of the unit but facing the front of the unit and the
bathroom. Staff 8 pointed to the front of the unit as being the
location of Staff 12. Staff 8 stated she could see everything from
her location including into the bathroom.
Documents Reviewed:
 Incident Report dated 3/1/23 at 7:40pm. The report did not
indicate who wrote it. It stated Youth A was in Unit 4 when
he began bullying a peer who uses diapers and wipes.
Youth A was running around throwing diapers and wipes at
his peer. Youth from Unit 3 saw Youth A hit his peer in the
genital area with the wipes. The youth from Unit 3
encouraged Youth A to stop. Youth A then threw a box of
wipes at staff so the youth from Unit 3 ran towards Youth A
and cornered him. Staff 8 who had the wipes thrown at her
attempted to use TCI breaking up a fight to remove the
boys from the area. Staff 2 also assisted with breaking up
the fight. Staff 12 managed the environment by removing
the other boys. Youth A was then walked out of the unit
with another youth. Youth A’s head was injured, and the
PM was contacted and Youth A was taken to the ER.
 Shift log dated 3/1/23 for 2nd shift: The log states Youth A
pulled the fire alarm, was punching cardboard on the wall,
11

called staff a “bitch,” put a tissue roll in the toilet, squirted
soap all over the bathroom floor, kicked bathroom walls,
and trying to break the walls loose. Youth A stated he was
jumped by two peers. Youth A was taken to the hospital.
The log was signed by Staff 7, Staff 8, and Staff 12.
 Supervisor log dated 3/1/23 from 2nd shift. The log was
completed by Staff 7 as indicated by her signature on the
log. The log states Youth C, Youth E, and Youth G all had
Therapeutic Crisis Intervention at 7:40pm. Youth A had a
knot on his head from the fight. Staff 12 had unusual
behavior with a youth and was written up. Youth A was
jumped by youth from unit 3. PM and medical were
contacted. Youth A was taken to the hospital. Unit 2 was in
the game room when this occurred.
 Staff 7 employee file: Staff 7 was written up on 3/2/23 for
line of sight, improper supervision and failure to report.
Staff 7 was hired on 12/7/20. Her last TCI training was
done on 11/22/22.
 Staff 12 employee file: Staff 12 was written up and
terminated on 3/2/23 for cell phone use and line of sight.
